channel.title: Git on Zhenjie Ruan's Tech Vault

item.title: Learning Note 1
item.description:
Python

As we all know, python string is immutable, so here is a little trick to reverse python string:

a = '123123'
a = a[::-1] # became 321321

the syntax here means a[from:to:step]

Vim

Using verbose before set can be useful to figure out why some setting in .vimrc is not working, used this to solve tab setting issue.

Git

git submodule can be used to add another git repo into current git repo.
